text:
We saw developers are
spending a lot of time

on the things that
they shouldn't be doing.

The developers need to write a code for
the business, so that it generates revenue.
But if developers will keep on doing

the infrastructure stuff,
it doesn't add any value.

The way AWS is helping us
is that AWS is providing us EKS tools,

Karpenter tools, and all the tools
to manage services in a more reliable way.

That's meant to make our life easy,
and it helps developers

to do the things which
they are supposed to do.
So developers are writing the code,

developers are pushing things out
in production in a more reliable wayâ€”

in more of a streamlined way,
which is same across the board.

If you want to grow from
70 clusters to 100 clusters

to 1000 clusters,
you can do it in a few minutes.
You don't have to wait.

While we are scaling our infrastructure,
the most important piece is the monitoring.

This is where we are using the AMP,
which is Amazon Managed Service for Prometheus,
that allows us to look into the clusters.

And recently
we have hooked up AMP with Kubecost.

So we are able to monitor the clusters,
but with help of AMP

and Kubecost, we are able to see
how efficiently they are being used.

Building on AWS provides Slack value
from a reliability perspective,

security perspective,
ease of operation, and efficiency.
